page.title: 12NATURE RESERVE IN BRADWELL
page.content: Now that the nature reserve at {Woodlands Middle School}has been established, there are plans to improve it as more money is raised. Recently, the project was boosted with a national award of Â£500. This money has been used to make a tree-lined lane up to the reserve. Now people will be able to approach the reserve unobserved. A bird hide has recently been erected with money raised by the Parents and Friends Association. Other plans include a second and larger pond to encourage birds to overwinter here. One of the aims of this project was to restore the name of Woodlands. In years to come we hope this aim will have been achieved.
